subject: Writing
title: Fear-Based Marketing
description: A micro-lesson that makes Fear-Based Marketing usable.

hook.text: Listerine didn't invent mouthwash â€” it invented the fear of bad breath. Then it sold the cure.

buildup.text: In the 1920s, Listerine ads warned that 'halitosis' (a medical-sounding word they popularized) destroyed romances.

discovery.text: The strategy worked brilliantly: create anxiety, then offer your product as the solution. Fear sells.

twist.text: Insurance, security systems, pharmaceuticals, and cleaning products all use the same fear-then-fix formula today.

climax.text: Fear-based marketing exploits our survival instincts â€” the brain prioritizes threats over opportunities.

punchline.text: The best ad campaigns don't sell hope. They sell fear.

quiz.question: What marketing strategy did Listerine pioneer?
options: Creating a fear, then selling the cure
